overview: From 2025-06-21 to 2025-06-22, elizaos/elizaos.github.io had 1 new PRs (1 merged), 2 new issues, and 4 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Move wallet address fetching to pipelines instead of NextJS build
topIssues.author: META-DREAMER
topIssues.body:
The new caching logic for fetching wallet addresses isnt ideal because its fetching from github during the NextJS build instead of in the Pipelines workflow where all the other github data fetching happens.

Should update frontend build so it only queries the database for wallet addresses, and move the logic for fetching wallet addresses from github into the ingest pipeline. Additionally, githubService.ts should be deprecated in favour of the github.ts class that already exists.

topIssues.title: update docs
topIssues.author: madjin
topIssues.body: mention we have to explicitly say that any code that is fetching data from github / external APIs and storing in the database should only ever run in the pipelines

topPRs.title: feat: Add gold checkmark icon for linked wallets
topPRs.author: madjin
topPRs.body:
This commit introduces a gold checkmark icon next to the username on your user profile page for users who have linked their Ethereum or Solana wallets.

Key changes:
- Added a new `GoldCheckmarkIcon.tsx` component to display an SVG checkmark.
- Modified `UserProfile.tsx` to:
    - Fetch wallet information using the existing `getUserWalletData` function.
    - Conditionally display the `GoldCheckmarkIcon` next to the username if a wallet address (`ethAddress` or `solAddress`) is present.
    - Wrap the icon with a `Tooltip` component that shows "Wallet linked" on hover.
- Ensured the icon is styled appropriately using Tailwind CSS and aligns correctly with the username.

The icon provides a clear visual indicator of wallet verification, enhancing user trust and information clarity on the profile page. I confirmed correct functionality through manual code review and scenario simulation.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Introduced support for linking multiple blockchain wallets (e.g., Ethereum, Solana) to user profiles, with a unified system for managing and displaying linked wallets.
  - Added visual indicators (badges and tooltips) for users with linked wallets on profile and leaderboard pages.
  - Implemented robust wallet address validation and chain support logic.

- **Enhancements**
  - Improved leaderboard and profile displays to show all linked wallets, replacing previous Ethereum/Solana-only handling.
  - Streamlined wallet data retrieval and caching for faster, more reliable updates.
  - Expanded documentation with detailed guides on pipelines, workflows, and wallet linking.

- **Database Changes**
  - Added a new table for wallet addresses and updated the users table to track wallet data updates.
  - Updated database schema and migration scripts to support wallet linking features.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Improved error handling and logging for wallet data retrieval and processing.

- **Chores**
  - Updated dependencies and refined internal workflows for data pipelines and deployment.
  - Refactored and removed obsolete code and hooks related to wallet linking.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: Remove githubService, update github.ts class to replace it.
topPRs.author: META-DREAMER
topPRs.body:
Closes #130 

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Added a new pipeline step to ingest wallet addresses for users, with tracking of successful and failed ingestions.
  - Introduced a function to retrieve user wallet data from the database.

- **Improvements**
  - Enhanced GitHub API integration with strong typing, validation, and expanded repository and file management capabilities.
  - Refactored wallet data ingestion for more explicit handling of GitHub repository existence and improved cache logic.
  - Updated pipeline context creation to require explicit GitHub token and structured options.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Updated wallet data retrieval in leaderboard and profile pages for improved accuracy.

- **Chores**
  - Adjusted database migration and restore workflows, including migration journal file handling and cleanup steps.
  - Removed redundant or obsolete workflow steps related to database migrations.

- **Refactor**
  - Consolidated and streamlined GitHub API services, removing legacy wallet linking service files.
  - Updated pipeline types to support chaining additional steps.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
